Job Title: Scientific Program Manager - Remote

Location: Bar Harbor, ME

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
Reporting within the JMCRS Business Units, the incumbent provides program-level support for new hardware/software products tailored for digital in vivo projects and services across JAX Mice and Services business units. The incumbent works directly with the business unit and scientific program management to help manage the customer success journey from a post-sale perspective and work directly with clients to successfully implement new hardware/software digital in vivo solutions while identifying new client growth opportunities. The incumbent will provide scientific guidance for the client and will monitor/measure progression and success of the projects that could include digital biomarkers via computer vision, machine learning and AI to profile animal behavior. The incumbent works to streamline stakeholder communications and align deliverables for the clients’ outcome. Additionally, they assist product managers by providing voice of customer during a products’ development and assist with resources to speed development. As an extension of this role, they will provide critical feedback to inform mid- to long-term strategic planning for the business units and ensure alignment of cross-functional teams to organizational priorities.

The salary range is $84,300 - $141,138. Salary will be determined based on qualifications and experience.

Key Responsibilities And Essential Functions

Manage the customer success journey. Build relationships with customers and improve probability of successful product implementation. This includes developing training materials and informational resources for customers and helping customer sites onboard and use the product optimally. Note: This will require travelling to customer sitesUnderstand the ever-evolving landscape of drug discovery and development and track digital in vivo engagements within customer sitesCommunicate about network/security needs to customer sites and serve as a liaison with software team to ensure seamless product installationEnsure sites have hardware/software necessary for installation and serve as the key point of communication for ongoing customer requestsMonitor customer studies to ensure studies are running and capturing data appropriatelyProvide ongoing feedback to product development and marketing teams on customer engagement and issues with productWork with Salesforce to triage customer support requestsServe as primary contact for customers and as a liaison between customer and product and marketing teams and work with respective teams to support resolution of product issues that ariseWork closely with the product team and alliance manager to ensure that the customer’s experience and ultimately the impact of the product is optimized

Minimum Qualifications

Advanced degree in relevant discipline (PhD, MS) and a minimum of 5 years in program, product, or customer facing role preferred.Experience in mouse-based research and/or biomedical research marketplace preferred as well as customer facing experienceDemonstrated ability to lead cross-functional project teams in a complex, matrixed environment, with ownership of timelines, documents, and deliverablesDemonstrated experience in making important decisions, often under some pressure and tight time deadlines, which carry large financial consequencesAbility to find innovative ways to resolve problems and ability to prioritize and balance parallel workstreamsWorking with machine learning generative AI as applied to problems in healthcare and biopharmaTranslational or clinical biomarker development supports multiple pipeline programsAnalytical validation of biomarker assays in preclinical modelsManages projects with stakeholders in research, biostats, medical, bioinformatics, pharmacology, and safety for effective integration of biomarker strategies in client’s program's development planBiopharma or biotechnology in vivo experienceQuantitative behavioral analysisAnalyzing large scale data setsOutstanding communication track recordAbility to travel up to 30% , both domestic and international

#CA-DS5

About JAX

The Jackson Laboratory is an independent, nonprofit biomedical research institution with a National Cancer Institute-designated Cancer Center and nearly 3,000 employees in locations across the United States (Maine, Connecticut, California), Japan and China. Its mission is to discover precise genomic solutions for disease and empower the global biomedical community in the shared quest to improve human health.

Founded in 1929, JAX applies over nine decades of expertise in genetics to increase understanding of human disease, advancing treatments and cures for cancer, neurological and immune disorders, diabetes, aging and heart disease. It models and interprets genomic complexity, integrates basic research with clinical application, educates current and future scientists, and provides critical data, tools and services to the global biomedical community. For more information, please visit www.jax.org .

EEO Statement

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
